messages: c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:56): how do you call an object that might be initialized only once and then it's passed between modules by reference?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (18:56): could this fall under the definition of singleton?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:02): is there a way to prevent prototype from being used more than once?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:04): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: module itself is a singleton?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:04): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: don't think like Java :)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:05): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: I never programmed in Java
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:05): good for you :)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:05): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: I just had this idea that by using this pattern I could completely eliminate global variables

c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:06): e.g. instead of having window.settings object for sharing settings between all modules I could create one instance of settings after app launch and then load it from other modules with require()
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:07): I mean there is no require() on client-side by default, but I guess you know what I mean

169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:09): hello guys, i have one problem... i have a table where each TD is canvas (just has to be like this). i generate table with javascript and i dont put canvas inside. when i want to put it, i first get width and height of td and create canvas inside that td with the same size. why does my TD size increase? (it goes from like 280 to 390)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:10): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: are you sure you have no padding set on TDs?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:11): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: tables should be used for laying out tabular data
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:12): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: do you know require.js?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:12): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: yeah, it has nothing to do with require() from Node.js
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:13): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: but in a sense when you require() module once it's constructed once and it's a singleton
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:13): no prototype needed
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:20): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: in Node.js when you require the same module two times then you will get two separate instances

c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:20): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: in the pattern that I'm thinking about the second require() should return reference to the object returned by first require()
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:21): so that there should be only one instance of the object in the whole app
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:21): alternatively, the second require could return error
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:23): is this how require.js works?
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:28): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: i have no paddings on TDs
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:30): If I have a canvas element, and I've stretched it using 3D transform, is there a way I can increase the draw resolution?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (19:31): i don't know about <canvas> much, but it's always a bit intriguing the ways people are trying to use it
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:33): Indeed. I'm personally using it as a way to detect touch detection of irregular shapes on a map, and then manipulating the shape once it is touched
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:35): Kind of an advanced <map> function
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (19:37): This is a cool header to prank your fellow web dev =D --> <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=5">

38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (19:37): (13 hours 40 mins ago) <paul_irish> tell a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d modernizr only checks for the validation. you can't test for a UI. but i got confirmation from both gecko & webkit that validation for dates will land at the same time as UI. they know feature detection is important.
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (19:38): thanks paul_irish!

169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:43): i have a table where each TD is canvas (just has to be like this). i generate table with javascript and i dont put canvas inside. when i want to put it, i first get width and height of td and create canvas inside that td with the same size. why does my TD size increase? (it goes from like 280 to 390)
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:43): Oh lovely :p
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:44): Padding/margins?
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:44): there are no paddings and margins i believe
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:44): White-space in the code?
9f873a67efcfe48cac10405dc48d2263 (19:44): [spaces, tabs, new lines, etc]
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:44): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: there must be something wrong with your CSS, could you show us the site?
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:45): fri.kicks-ass.net/vegetko/index.html
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:46): u generate a table if you put like 2 in the first thing, click the button and put like ('s',1,1) in the second thing, click 'dodaj' and click on start image
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:47): ohh and the first row doesnt have canvas (the one with zeros)
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:50): u got the table?
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:50): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: "table tr td" has "width: 5%"
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:50): yes, that cuz i want all cells to have the same width
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:50): and i read somewhere that should do it (some trick or something)
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:56): sorry, I got disconnected
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:56): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: try something like this:
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:56): tdElement.style.setProperty('width', canvasWidth);
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:57): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: AFAIK only one module instance is created per import if the module path is the same in require.js
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:57): otherwise module memory bloat would be terrible
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (19:57): ok ill try
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:57): and JIT compiler would cry
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (19:57): 169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7: if you already inert the canvas with JS, I guess it shouldn't be a problem to set the td width w
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (20:02): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: ahh, you are right: http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.4.2/api/modules.html#caching
c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6 (20:02): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: strange I haven't noticed this before
169e53c0dea6acddaff000780ee003b7 (20:03): c63a5cfce0a1819ebbe4a19e074356b6: td now has attribute width (same value as canvas) but the size is still the same (cant upload to ftp now, dont have access)
